\chapter{Quickstart}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:quickstart}}\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart::doc}}

\section{Installing}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:installing}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
To get started with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}}, install the latest stable release from \sphinxhref{https://pypi.org/project/httpsuite/}{PyPi}:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
pip install httpsuite
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:getting-started}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
There are two principal abstractions to be aware of it in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
These classes represent an HTTP/1.x request and response message, and offer a high\sphinxhyphen{}level API to {\hyperref[\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-modify}]{\sphinxtermref{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{modify}}}},
{\hyperref[\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-compile}]{\sphinxtermref{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{compile}}}}, and {\hyperref[\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-parse}]{\sphinxtermref{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{parse}}}} them. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} can be initialized via two different
methods.


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_()}}}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:init}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} object with the given parameter.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}

\PYG{n}{request} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{method}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{POST}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{User\PYGZhy{}Agent}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{httpsuite}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{12}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{body}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Hello world.}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Response}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{status}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{200}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{status\PYGZus{}msg}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{OK}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{User\PYGZhy{}Agent}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{httpsuite}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{body}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Hi back!}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{.parse()}}}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:parse}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Or, parse from \sphinxtitleref{bytes} to create a new \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} with the given details.


\subsubsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:bytes}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Most useful when using socket connections.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}

\PYG{n}{req} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{parse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{b}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{GET / HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{User\PYGZhy{}Agent: httpsuite}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length: 12}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Hello world}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{resp} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{parse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+sa}{b}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1 200 OK}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{User\PYGZhy{}Agent: httpsuite}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length: 12}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Hi back!}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Modify}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:modify}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The next probable step after initializing a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} object is to {\hyperref[\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-modify}]{\sphinxtermref{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{modify}}}} and
{\hyperref[\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-compile}]{\sphinxtermref{\DUrole{xref,std,std-term}{compile}}}}. Object modification is done as one would expect.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{method} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{POST}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{300}
\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status\PYGZus{}msg} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+sa}{b}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Continue}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Notice that setting object properties is type\sphinxhyphen{}agnostic. Properties can be modified to either \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}},
or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bytes}} objects. Internally, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}} automatically converts every property of a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{request}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{response}} into an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Item}}, which is a low\sphinxhyphen{}level interface to allow easy setting and comparissons on the
fly. Similarly to setting properties, one can be assured of type\sphinxhyphen{}agnostic property comparissions.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+m+mi}{300}     \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} True}
\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{300}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}   \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} True}
\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+sa}{b}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{300}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}  \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} True}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Compile}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:compile}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
After modifying a message compilation allows the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} objects to be compiled into
less maluable yet useful types. Those types being \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bytes}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}}.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{json}

\PYG{n}{body} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{json}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dumps}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hello}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{world}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{request} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{method}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{POST}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/post}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Host}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{httpbin.org}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Connection}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{close}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Accept}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{*/*}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{body}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{.raw}}}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:raw}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Useful to use with sockets.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{raw}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{l+s+sa}{b}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{POST /post HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Host: httpbin.org}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Connection: close}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length: 18}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{Accept: */*}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}r}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{hello}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{: }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{world}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsection{\sphinxstyleliteralintitle{\sphinxupquote{\_\_str\_\_}}}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:str}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Pretty print of the object.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\(\rightarrow\) POST /post HTTP/1.1
\(\rightarrow\) Host: httpbin.org
\(\rightarrow\) Connection: close
\(\rightarrow\) Content\PYGZhy{}Length: 18
\(\rightarrow\) Accept: */*
\(\rightarrow\) \PYGZob{}\PYGZdq{}hello\PYGZdq{}: \PYGZdq{}world\PYGZdq{}\PYGZcb{}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{More}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Quickstart:more}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
If you finished this guide and want to continue learning more you can do so by reading the package’s documentation found
on the left menu.


\chapter{http}
\label{\detokenize{module/http:http}}\label{\detokenize{module/http::doc}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite}\PYG{n+nn}{.}\PYG{n+nn}{http} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Message}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:module-httpsuite.http}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!httpsuite.http@\spxentry{httpsuite.http}}\index{httpsuite.http@\spxentry{httpsuite.http}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Classes for parsing, modifying, and re\sphinxhyphen{}compiling HTTP messages.


\bigskip\hrule\bigskip

\index{Message (class in httpsuite.http)@\spxentry{Message}\spxextra{class in httpsuite.http}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Message}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Message}}}{\emph{abc.ABC}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Abstract class that contains shared methods and properties accessible by both the
Request and Response classes.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{warning}{Warning:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This class is not intended to be used by itself. Note that Message is an
abstraction that represents the shared properties and methods of both a Request
and Response instance. All functions displayed in Message are, therefore,
accessible by both the Request and Response classes.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{\_\_init\_\_() (Message method)@\spxentry{\_\_init\_\_()}\spxextra{Message method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Message.__init__}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{protocol}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{headers}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{body}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Initializes an HTTP Message.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{protocol}} \textendash{} “\textless{}major\textgreater{}.\textless{}minor\textgreater{}” numbering scheme to indicate versions of the
protocol.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{headers}} \textendash{} Collection of case\sphinxhyphen{}insensitive name followed by a colon (:).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{body}} \textendash{} Data associated with the message.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\begin{center}\sphinxstylestrong{Parse}
\end{center}\index{parse() (Message.httpsuite.http.Message method)@\spxentry{parse()}\spxextra{Message.httpsuite.http.Message method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Message.httpsuite.http.Message.parse}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite.http.Message.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{parse}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{message}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Parses the passed \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{messaged}} into a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cls}} instance (either a {\hyperref[\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Request}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}}}}} or {\hyperref[\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Response}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}}}}} object).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{message}} \textendash{} The primative or object to convert into a Request or Response object.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
An initialized object of class \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cls}}.

\item[{Raises}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{RequiredAwait}} \textendash{} Attempting to parse asynchronous object without ‘await’ statement.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\begin{center}\sphinxstylestrong{Properties}
\end{center}
\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite.http.Message.raw()}} function will return the message with proper \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textbackslash{}r\textbackslash{}n}} escape characters. It can be
used directly with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sockets}} or any low\sphinxhyphen{}level communication system that requires properly formatted HTTP
messages.
\end{sphinxadmonition}
\index{string (Message property)@\spxentry{string}\spxextra{Message property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Message.string}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{string}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
String representation of the Message.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
Message as a string, without any arrows.

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{raw (Message property)@\spxentry{raw}\spxextra{Message property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/http:httpsuite.http.Message.raw}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{raw}}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bytes representation of the Message.

\bigskip\hrule\bigskip

\index{TwoWayFrozenDict (class in httpsuite.interface)@\spxentry{TwoWayFrozenDict}\spxextra{class in httpsuite.interface}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{module/interface:httpsuite.interface.TwoWayFrozenDict}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{TwoWayFrozenDict}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{dictionary}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\{\}}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{**}\DUrole{n}{kwargs}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A frozen dictionary with two\sphinxhyphen{}way capabilities. Locks a dictionary in place after
initilization, and provides accessability via key and value.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
All the keys and values inside TwoWayFrozenDict are Item objects, which allows
easy comparissions to check if an item is inside the TwoWayFrozenDict mapping.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\end{fulllineitems}



\bigskip\hrule\bigskip

\chapter{Advance Use}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Advance Use:advance-use}}\label{\detokenize{writeups/Advance Use::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Advance examples of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}} being used.


\section{Sockets}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Advance Use:sockets}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{} Example of using httpsuite to communicate with an external web server using sockets.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{1. Open a new socket.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{2. Creates the request to be sent via Request object.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{3. Connect to httpbin.org via socket.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{4. Send generated request to server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{5. Receive raw response from server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{6. Parse the server\PYGZsq{}s response with Response object.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{7. Loads the response\PYGZsq{}s body via JSON.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{8. Close socket.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{socket}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{json}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 1. Open a new socket.}
\PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{AF\PYGZus{}INET}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{SOCK\PYGZus{}STREAM}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 2. Creates the request to be sent via Request object.}
\PYG{n}{body} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{json}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dumps}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{hello}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{world}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n}{request} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{(}
    \PYG{n}{method}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{POST}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/post}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{headers}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Host}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{httpbin.org}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Connection}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{close}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Content\PYGZhy{}Length}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{n+nb}{len}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{,}
        \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Accept}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{*/*}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{,}
    \PYG{n}{body}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{,}
\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Prints the raw request.}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{====== Raw Request ======}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{raw}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 3. Connect to httpbin.org via socket.}
\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{connect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{httpbin.org}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{80}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 4. Send generated request to server.}
\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sendall}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{raw}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 5. Receive raw response from server.}
\PYG{n}{response\PYGZus{}raw} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{recv}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4096}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Prints the raw response.}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{====== Raw Response ======}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response\PYGZus{}raw}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 6. Parse the server\PYGZsq{}s response with Response object.}
\PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{parse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response\PYGZus{}raw}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Prints the request and the response (pretty\PYGZhy{}print).}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{====== Request and Response ======}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 7. Loads the response\PYGZsq{}s body via JSON.}
\PYG{n}{body} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{json}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{loads}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{string}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Prints the loaded json (\PYGZsq{}dumps\PYGZsq{} for pretty\PYGZhy{}print).}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{====== Json ======}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{json}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{dumps}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{body}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{indent}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{4}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 8. Close socket.}
\PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{close}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\section{Microservice}
\label{\detokenize{writeups/Advance Use:microservice}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\},numbers=left,firstnumber=1,stepnumber=1]
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{} Very primative example of a socket microservice architecture using httpsuite.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{Server and Client functions are ran through the \PYGZsq{}multiprocessing\PYGZsq{} module, so}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{to act as two seperate entities. For the sake of clarity, only the server function}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{prints anything to console. Entities are documented seperately.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{httpsuite} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{Response}
\PYG{k+kn}{from} \PYG{n+nn}{multiprocessing} \PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n}{Process}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{socket}
\PYG{k+kn}{import} \PYG{n+nn}{time}


\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{server}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Simple socket server that uses httpsuite to interpret and reply.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    1. Opens a new socket.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    2. Binds to 127.0.0.1:8080 and waits until new connection.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    3. Accepts connection from external source.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    4. Receive the data from the client.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    5. Parse the clients request.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    6. Interpret the request.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    7. Reply to the client.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    8. Close the connection with the client.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 1. Opens a new socket.}
    \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{AF\PYGZus{}INET}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{SOCK\PYGZus{}STREAM}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 2. Binds to 127.0.0.1:8080 and waits until new connection.}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{bind}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{127.0.0.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8080}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{listen}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 3. Accepts connection from external source.}
    \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{address} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{accept}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{===== Connecting With New Client =====}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{address}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 4. Receive the data from the client.}
    \PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{recv}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1024}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 5. Parse the clients request.}
    \PYG{n}{request} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{parse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{===== Received Data From Client =====}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 6. Interpret the request.}
    \PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Response}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{status}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{200}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{status\PYGZus{}msg}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{OK}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{target} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{body} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Homepage of the microservice.}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{k}{elif} \PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{target} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/data}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{body} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{You are accessing the /data directory of this microservice.}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}
    \PYG{k}{else}\PYG{p}{:}
        \PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+m+mi}{404}
        \PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{status\PYGZus{}msg} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{Not Found}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{===== Replying to Client =====}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 7. Reply to the client.}
    \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sendall}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{raw}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{===== Closing Connection to Client =====}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+se}{\PYGZbs{}n}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 8. Close the connection with the client, and the server.}
    \PYG{n}{conn}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{close}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{close}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}


\PYG{k}{def} \PYG{n+nf}{client}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{l+s+sd}{\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}Simple socket client that uses httpmodule to request server resource.}

\PYG{l+s+sd}{    1. Opens a new socket.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    2. Connects the server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    3. Creates a valid request to send to the server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    4. Sends the request.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    5. Receives reply from the server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    6. Parses the reply from the server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    7. Closes connection with the server.}
\PYG{l+s+sd}{    \PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}\PYGZdq{}}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Note: Sleeps so that the socket server can boot\PYGZhy{}up before.}
    \PYG{n}{time}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sleep}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 1. Opens a new socket.}
    \PYG{n}{s} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{AF\PYGZus{}INET}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{socket}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{SOCK\PYGZus{}STREAM}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 2. Connects the server.}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{connect}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{127.0.0.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{l+m+mi}{8080}\PYG{p}{)}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 3. Creates a valid request to send to the server.}
    \PYG{n}{request} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Request}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{method}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{GET}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{/}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{protocol}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{HTTP/1.1}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 4. Sends the request.}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sendall}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{request}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{raw}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 5. Receives reply from the server.}
    \PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{recv}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1024}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 6. Parses the reply from the server.}
    \PYG{n}{response} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Response}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{parse}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} 7. Closes connection with the server.}
    \PYG{n}{s}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{close}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}


\PYG{k}{if} \PYG{n+nv+vm}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}name\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}} \PYG{o}{==} \PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}main\PYGZus{}\PYGZus{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{:}
    \PYG{n}{p1} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Process}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{server}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{p2} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{Process}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{target}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{n}{client}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{p1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{daemon} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{True}
    \PYG{n}{p2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{daemon} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{k+kc}{True}

    \PYG{n}{p1}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{start}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{n}{p2}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{start}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{p}{)}

    \PYG{n}{time}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{sleep}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+m+mi}{3}\PYG{p}{)}
    \PYG{k}{raise} \PYG{n+ne}{SystemExit}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Glossary}
\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary:glossary}}\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary::doc}}\begin{description}
\item[{compile\index{compile@\spxentry{compile}|spxpagem}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-compile}}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
In the context of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}}, compiling means converting a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} object into
another more useable type, typically either \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{str}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{bytes}}.

\item[{message\index{message@\spxentry{message}|spxpagem}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-message}}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
The parent object of both an HTTP request and response.

\item[{modify\index{modify@\spxentry{modify}|spxpagem}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-modify}}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
In the context of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}}, modifying means changing attributes in either the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} or
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} objects. When modifications are applied to these objects usually compilation follows.

\item[{parse\index{parse@\spxentry{parse}|spxpagem}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{misc/Glossary:term-parse}}}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
In the context of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{httpsuite}}, parsing means interpreting an external type and creating a representative
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Response}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Request}} object.

\end{description}

\label{\detokenize{misc/Versions:versions}}\label{\detokenize{misc/Versions::doc}}

\end{itemize}

\label{\detokenize{misc/Versions:id2}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Updated core \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Message}} to include \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{protocol}} by default.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Removed \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{info.py}} and place content inside \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_\_init\_\_.py}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Formatted some tests with Black.

\end{itemize}
